title: Understanding BMI and Anorexia
text: Anorexia nervosa is often associated with a significantly low body weight. The Body Mass Index (BMI) is a common measure used to assess whether an individual is underweight, normal weight, overweight, or obese.

title: BMI Categories
text:
The World Health Organization (WHO) classifies BMI as follows:
- Underweight: BMI less than $$18.5$$
- Normal weight: BMI $$18.5$$ to $$24.9$$
- Overweight: BMI $$25$$ to $$29.9$$
- Obesity: BMI $$30$$ or greater

title: Identifying the BMI Range for Anorexia
text: Based on the WHO classification, what BMI range would be associated with anorexia nervosa?
